text: Happy #PrideMonth! As we celebrate the LGBTQ+ community this month and every month let's honor the tremendous progress our nation has made towards equality and remember the work we have left to do. http

This Saturday I'll be joining community leaders for a discussion on substance use disorder and a training on how to administer Narcan—a life-saving treatment for opioid overdose. This crisis affects us all regardless of political party and it will take all of us to fight it. http
On #MemorialDay we say thank you and honor the memory of those who sacrificed everything to defend our freedom. http
This #MemorialDay and every day we commemorate those who gave their lives for our nation. May we cherish our freedom and never forget its true cost. #MemorialDay http

Making sure our communities have the resources they need to support first responders is critical. That's why I'm proud to advocate for federal funding to equip Aurora with next-generation technologies and capabilities to keep our communities safe. http
Can't wait to read these. Hearing from young people from our communities is one of the best parts of this job. http

I can't think of projects any more important than enhancing public safety and upgrading our infrastructure.I'll always fight to make sure IL-11 communities like Aurora get their fair share of federal resources. http
Weapons of war have no place in our communities. It's time to reinstate the Assault Weapons Ban.

Since 2020 gun violence is the leading cause of death among children and teenagers. When car crashes were the leading cause of death to children we changed the laws. We made cars and driving safer. Now it’s time to act on #gunviolenceprevention.
